str2: And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

Large, great, in the widest sense.
And, even, also, namely.
Little, small. Including the comparative mikroteros apparently a primary word; small (figuratively) dignity).

str2: A prolonged form of a primary stao stah'-o; to stand, used in various applications.

str2: To open. From ana and oigo; to open up.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.

str2: A primary verb; to 'grave', especially to write; figuratively, to describe.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
